column1: #Text=Polycrystalline ceramic samples of (100–x)Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3–xPbTiO3 (PMN–xPT) compositions across the MPB (with x ​= ​20, 27, 30, 32, 33.5, 35, 37, and 40), were prepared by mixing stoichiometric amounts of PbO (99.9%, Sigma Aldrich), Nb2O5 (99.9%, Sigma Aldrich), TiO2 (99.8% Alfa Aesar), and MgO (99.95%, Alfa Aesar).
#Text=The MgO was pre-milled separately, before mixing, for better reactivity due to its low diffusivity.

#Text=The homogenized powder mixture was then mechanochemically synthesized in a planetary mill at 300 min−1 for 96 ​h, using 20-mm tungsten carbide milling balls, which resulted in the perovskite formation.
#Text=After the synthesis, another milling was performed in an attritor mill at 800 ​rpm for 4 ​h in isopropanol using 3-mm Yttria-stabilized zirconia balls.

#Text=The dried powders were uniaxially pressed into pellets at 50 ​MPa, isostatically pressed at 300 ​MPa and then sintered in closed alumina crucibles and buried in a packing powder of the same composition as the pellet.
#Text=The same sintering procedure, i.e., 1200 ​°C for 16 ​h with a heating/cooling rate of 2 ​°C/min was employed for all compositions to ensure comparable microstructures.
